snippet: There are far more co-ops than condos in New York City, but the gap has been narrowing in neighborhoods with a bigger concentration of new developments.
abstract: Susan Stellin Getting Started column examines the differences between New York CIty co-ops and condominiums, looking at inventory, price, approval processes and building rules; offers advice on what factors to consider when deciding between the two.
lead_paragraph: There are far more co-ops than condos in New York City, but the gap has been narrowing in neighborhoods with a bigger concentration of new developments.

headline.print_headline: Co-op vs. Condo: The Differences Are Narrowing
headline.seo: Getting Started – Choosing Between a Co-op and a Condo
headline.main: Co-op vs. Condo: The Differences Are Narrowing
